intro: Eriochilus dilatatus var. latifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved eriochilus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense spikes, and are usually pink or purple in color. This variety is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
